posts.cooked:
Everything is plaintext on telegram server, so technically, they could moderate groups related to criminal activities.
End to end encryption is mandatory to be responsible of messaging QOS only and not content.

In theory, I agree. In practice, especially in regard to Telegram? Talk about sticking your head in the sand and not paying attention to just how far that idea is not even visible on the horizon anymore.

posts.cooked: I have always wondered why criminals continue to use Telegram when there are much safer and anonymous alternatives.
I don‚Äôt mind Telegram being branded as the #1 choice for criminals if that keeps such qualifications away from these alternatives .
Maybe it‚Äôs about the group size limitation?!

posts.cooked: This is what I‚Äôve always assumed. One communication channel to thousands of people is easier to manage, so they‚Äôre trading security for convenience, which you‚Äôd think criminals wouldn‚Äôt want to do.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
Why would anyone care about encryption in a group read by thousands who can freely join? Anything posted there should be considered public anyway, just as the Signal Matrix room is unencrypted.

Start that group with an account on a burner phone and you can still be reasonably anonymous. In many countries it is easy to get an anonymous prepaid simcard.
